item.title: Cases handled by Legal Aid of Southeastern PA
item.description:
For this project, I worked with Legal Aid of Southeastern PA to help them find patterns in the types of services they provide to different geographic areas in the four counties they serve. Here is an anonymized version of the interactive maps I produced for them. Points were jittered randomly by a small amount, so while exact locations are inaccurate, any overall trends should still be apparent.

item.title: About
item.description:
I’m working on course development with DataCamp

I like statistics, R, and Python.

I wrote a thesis about asymptotic properties of network models.

All the photos were taken by me with a Minolta X-370 in various places in Oregon, Washington, and Maine.

item.title: Projects
item.description:
Local Dependence in Exponential Random Network Models

For my undergraduate thesis project at Reed College, I worked with random graph models used in social network analysis. I extended results about the existence and consistency of MLEs and the asymptotic distribution of statistics to a new class of model.

Crime in Northwest Philadelphia

An exploration of the locations of violent crime in northwest Philadelphia from 2006 to 2016 using shiny and leaflet.

Mapping legal services

Visualizations of the (anonymized) location of clients of Legal Aid of Southeastern PA and the type of representation they required, broken up by county.
